comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
Maybe have a look at the validations test for the leave plans.
As soon as a second deferred validation exists, this test may fail, depending on the order of the messages - there is a way of checking for a number of error messages.
Also, in keeping with the leave plan validations, you could go and set a valid start date and click validate again and make sure that the message doesn't appear

comments.author: Tom Gurrie

reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-1336: run service agreement validation on change status from pending to review

comments.author: Trevor Higgins
comments.comment:
As discussed:
Update rule javadocs
Update descriptions on process steps and links (just in clean env, dont bother in dev).
Update dev to remove Samples.Absence module (possibly via DB SQL deletion, dont worry about existing adjudication rules) and create your validationrules in correct Absence.ServiceAgreementCase
See if you can remove the Employer task from "Pending" step, as we dont really need it there. This means we need to put a pause on the step to ensure it only tries to move to review if the user manually does so.

comments.author: Sergio Torres
comments.comment: removed the task from the pending status and check that goes to the next step in case the service agreement is correct. Clean from the dev enviroment added new descriptions for the steps
